title: Jungles who can't clear krugs or raptors early should be compensated for the scuttle change
body:
And by 'can't clear,' I mean they take significant damage, to the point they can't contest or gank after doing them.

If I do both buffs, gromp, and wolves, I'm left with ~20 seconds where I have nothing to do. At the same time, I need to do wolves to hit level 3, and I can't effectively gank at level 2 because I'm at a disadvantage to the solo lanes.

Because of this, my ganks are now 100% predictable in every game, and the down time ensures I have little chance of winning against opponents whose champions have AoE in their kits, because they gain a significant EXP advantage during my down time.

On top of that, I'm now forced to always start red if I'm on the top team, which makes my path also completely predictable. 

If I try to start blue, I need to do both gromp and wolves before I go to my red. If the opponent knows I started blue, they can invade and steal my red while I'm at wolves, putting me at a massive disadvantage, because doing either of the top side camps will leave me too low to contest scuttle, after seeing my red is gone, aside from not being able to win duel without red. If I go straight to red without doing wolves, I have to backtrack for them, which is a huge loss of time and puts me at a disadvantage, similar to as if I had started red.

This change should not have happened.

Tbh jungle is just fucked. There’s no effective way for us to keep up into the late game, and our early game just got neutered for no real reason.

Krugs: You need to learn to use one krug to reduce the hits you take from other krugs. Large/Medium Krugs are large enough that if you orb around them, you can prevent hits from the other krugs. You can also pull them into a bush, and while they are running, you can reduce the hits you take as the run will hide you when entering bush.

A pro jungler can also reduce hits drastically simply by knowing their max auto attack range and resetting their attack position as soon as an attack activates, shortening the time between attacks, while reducing the hits taken. (You often have to do this on Red if your team doesn't leash you)

If you finish the whole blue jg, you still have to go to somewhere else to get level 3. You finish whole red side, boom you level 3 with three raptors to spare.

The gromp could take a small health buff and enough xp buff to get level 3 jg from blue side, effective jg pool would be drastically larger. This isn't champion strengths defining who plays jg, it's Riot arbitrarily choosing.

Facts. Objective. Undebatable.
